review_title: Game crashes before start dont buy
one_reviews_text: this game is grab it crashes before it starts. igive it back. dont buy it. testet with oculus quest
Crashed when I start the game with a oculus rift S

review_title: Love this game, it so much fun!
one_reviews_text:
11/20/2019
Started playing this game about two weeks ago. Game looks great, you look down at this little worrier troll character that you control.  If you have played Lucky's Tale then you will understand what this game looks like. Its a third person type game. The environments are beautiful, the game play can bring some challenges with fun puzzles and action. If you are not a patient person, this might not be for you. 

     My 7 year old likes the puzzles but does not like the action boss fights or mini battles. My older kids and I find that each boss fight just takes a little figuring out after that it becomes fun. This game is well done and lots of fun. 

Just two thing I would ask for would be:
1. The option to run a bit faster or sprint. 
2. And for the mini map to show the whole map explored per elemental area.

I played it with my CV1 but please do a "Quest" Port for all the other people! (And me for a second round)
I want more Games like this. Thanks a lot!

Come on Gunfire Games Fix that crash poblem!!! its so easy!!!

This would have been okay at launch with the VR gimmick but now feels antiquated. The movement is clunky and awkward (and your head affects the direction for some reason?) and combat varies between boring and frustrating. It's a Zelda clone but it lacks all of the shine and polish of a Zelda game, with ugly environments and character designs that look like Troll dolls. Puzzles are poorly designed as well, with the intended solution often unclear or majorly underwhelming.

You really can't go wrong if you like Zelda-style action adventure games, especially for £5.99. Worth every penny. Everything about this game screams Zelda down to the puzzles, home villiage, different dungeons and combat. It also looks REALLY nice when supersampled at 2.0 on my 1080 GPU with no performance issues at all.

Plays like a tech demo or an early 3D platformer. It's very easy to get cornered and killed quickly by enemies, animations are slow, switching weapons is slow, hitboxes are weird. This game had promise, but it feels like it was rushed through development.
For the price I couldn't possibly give this less than 5 stars. Good, challenging combat.

review_title: Broken please fix or at least remove
one_reviews_text: It's an easy fix and I know it is please fix or just remove your game gunfire

There is an easy fix to keep the game from crashing when launch (Google the fix),  I was a little hesitant purchasing this because of the "crash at launch" problem, but I am very glad I purchased!  in the spirit of Moss and Luckys Tale this game is a really cute and the battles seem decent enough!  I am an hour into it and it seems like there is allot to accomplish!  Graphics are good for a mobile port and I can't wait to jump back into the game and venture onward!

I figured out the problem of Herobound crashing is the OVRplugin.dll.
If you have Zombie Riot, copy over the dll from that one over to Herobound.

If you don't:
https://www.reddit.com/r/oculus/comments/ajw968/how_to_fix_herobound_spirit_champion/

Still, 1 star for Gunfire games not fixing this.

I used to play this game, and it worked fine.  Something has happened in the past few months though, and now the game will not launch.  It stalls at the games loading screen.  I have contacted both the devs and Oculus about this and both blame the other and say it is not their responsibility and have left it at that.  It pains me to say don't buy this game.  It does not work and is not supported any longer.
Please update this game, Devs! Love it! Would give it 4-5 stars if it ran. I'd really like to play again and have been recommeding it to others, which is how I found out it now crashes on launch.

This game is NOT working. It crashed the instant you try to load it. I saw others posting similar complaints.  Somebody did suggest that I replace the "OVRPlugin.dll" file.  I tried that..   that does help it a little -- when I replace the OVRPlugin.dll file, it then loads up the screen in the very beginning allowing me to select a new save file.. but I do NOT see this is on the oculus screen.  I ONLY see this on the computer monitor.  However, it does NOT allow me to use any controller to get any further.  Meanwhile, it only shows the loading screen on the oculus... I NEVER see the select save file on the oculus that is displayed on the computer monitor.

I CANNOT GET THIS TO WORK ON THE OCULUS RIFT..  and I DEFINITELY meet all the computer criteria to easily run it.

ANY HELP WOULD BE ENORMOUSLY APPRECIATED.  Thanks in advance.
Hasn't worked in several months. Dev not update with new Oculus runtime.

review_title: Keeps crashing since the latest update!
one_reviews_text: I was playing it for awhile and now it constantly crashes at startup since the new update. It says "The game crashed. The crash report folder named 2018-09-020234 next to game executable. It would be great if you'd send it to the developer of the game!"

review_title: Game crash - not working any longer
one_reviews_text: So, when will the developer or oculus take a look into that issue?

I cannot even install Herobound, always getting an error about internet connection, check details and retry...but all other apps are working and installing correctly....

please help!
So, you know, there's room for improvement.
Not much to say other than the title.

I was really interested by the good reviews. So I bought it. Game only crashes on start up.  I'll update my review when the game if you fix the problem.
---

Actually I'm past the limit to get refunds. I expected a update.

Nice and challenging platformer. As for me the game is much better than Chronos. There is a lot of action and different kind of enemies. You need to find right strategies to defeat them. There is similar game: Witchblood.

This is quite an enjoyable Zelda-style title in VR. I've put several hours into it but still have a ways to go. 

On the dowside there's no Touch support, but it plays great on a gamepad.

review_title: Simple but fun little adventure game
one_reviews_text: An entertaining few hours of simple puzzles and monster slaying. The characters, story and the gameplay are very simplistic by today's RPG standards, but it's all well put together with nice scenery and good implementation of the player's isometric viewpoint. It really works well in VR. On scoring it, I would give the game 3.5/5 if I could, but it's a decently made early attempt at making these kind of games in VR so 4/5 it is. A fair asking price too. Looking forward to seeing what the studio comes up with next in VR!

What a great game, I just finished it after about 6 and a half hours and thoroughly enjoyed it. I loved the 1 room at a time approach, with a camera that doesn't move about when the character moves. I would recommend this as a good game to get accustomed to VR if you are a new oculus owner and are worried about motion sickness, and getting your 'VR legs'.
Hope there's a follow up game, maybe with greater scope and more RPG elements, I'd pay for it!

This game is a must have and it's price is just unbelievable.
I totally agree on the Zelda feeling. If you think VR is not for platform game then try this one.
One warning though : it's difficulty makes it more suitable to grown ups.
Finally if you like this game I recommand Chronos which is a bit alike with a totally different world

The game has a decent length (roughly 6 to 7 hours) considering it's both VR and free. The graphics are good, vibrant but not awfully detailed and the 3D effect is only really good for things and characters that come close to your fixed view position. The fighting is interesting, with just enough variety for its length and there's a good portion of puzzling (30 to 40%). The world design is quite good, but unfortunately world 3 out of 4 is much smaller than all the others, to the point of seeming rushed. Overall a good game anyone with a Rift should try out.

I just bought my Oculus a week ago and saw this was free.  Looking back I would have been happy to have paid for it.  I've been a gamer since 1979 and I'm blessed to have been around long enough to see what I believe is the real next evolution in gaming.  Being 100% immersed is what it's all about.  I can only hope that VR truely catches on and we see this medium embraced.  Zelda VA anyone?

I would have easily paid 10 bucks for this little gem.  What a great game.  As someone said, the story and characters are zilch, but that's not what makes this game great.  The pin point accurate controls, the ambiance, the puzzles, hell, even the WoW-like graphics are all great.  I felt like I got teleported to this world with the fantastic implementation of 3D.  If it had dialog and a better story, I'd give it a 5.  But as it is, it's a solid 4.

The bottom line is, it's an awesome experience and you will have fun  (:

review_title: Well done! I hope to see more like this.
one_reviews_text:
Got sucked in for a couple hours the first time I played. I would really like to see more games (perhaps less cartoony, action rpg types) like this.

The controls can be a bit frustrating at times but overall this game is lots of fun and not too frustrating. Puzzles are fairly logical. I've only encountered one boss so far and haven't beat him yet.

The mapping system is a little confusing. I keep feeling like I'm leaving rooms behind, but I'm not sure.

Overall lots of fun and proof that not everything needs to be first-person in VR. There is room for different perspectives.

I was not sure about non ego-perspective games on VR. But this game changed my mind. Nice soundtrack, cute visiuals, simple but lovely gameplay. Reminds me of Zelda and for a free game is is absolutly worth playing. Well done, hope to see more Action Adventures for Oculus Rift, kind regards!

Upon loading the game, it says "Gamepad not detected".  

The XBox Controller is working perfectly. 

Other games have no issue and is also detected by "joy.cpl" control panel app.

Obviously a bug that needs fixing.

review_title: This is the Zelda that Nintendon't
one_reviews_text: Characters and story are boring, but the game and the environement is really interesting. It's fun to play and not frustrating. PS : It's perfectly working with the wireless xbone controller that came with the oculus rift.

I wasn't sure if I would like it at first.  It's a VERY different perspective in game playing.  I was hooked and played for several hours.  Very enjoyable.  Although, experiences may vary I guess.  It's in the top 5 of games I've played so far along with Robo Recall.

That is so stupid. After having no hopes for controller response and reading reviews the solution was simple - open up the window of the game when it launches to make controller work...usually it's alt+tab'd

For those saying "doesn't work" -- you need to use the xbox controller, not the touch ones.

Someone designed a fantastic 3D puzzler game, then decided to ruin it with a "you're locked in a room with the boss monster, now die over and over and over and over and over while you try to find the magic combo of moves and execute them perfectly for several rounds successively with a clumsy controller"-style combat game.     I basically had to give up because I couldn't beat half the boss battles in a reasonable number of attempts, and one I could never beat at all.

Does not work with wireless xbox one controller, no response to the joysticks or d-pad. It does work with my wired xbox 360 controller. Game is fun so far, graphics are decent.
And it's free at the moment. :)

I kinda enjoyed it since it mixes my favourite styles. However when the 20th try in a room doesnt succeed because they always kill me, thanks but I rather quit. I wanna enjoy this, not waste my time. I'd gladly visit my home for upgrades but it takes too much time to go back to the teleport stone with all the monsters respawning which i killed before...meh, lets do smth else instead of this game.
Music gets boring after some time spent in a realm.
Great little game that shows how good a zelda-style platformer can be in VR.

review_title: Crashing at door in Earth Realm
one_reviews_text: Would like to submit the logs to the developer so this can potentially be fixed but not sure where to send them. Good game til it stopped me from progressing.
...i've so much fun with the little Warrior! For free! This game is delightful.
It's not Zelda or Dark Souls, hell it's not even Chronos, but it'll do. It'll do.
It reminded me of the first time I played Zelda - it's not real hard but a lot of fun
Wonderful
i havent been able to play this game in months ive tried everything i can think of..

review_title: The Game turns on the Tv mode
one_reviews_text: I have an LG 3d TV and I use it as monitor. When I launch the game, it automatically turns on the 3d mode and everything crashes, I can´t do anything and I'm forced to reset the computer. I only have problem with this game, I can play other games pretty fine. I hope they fix it.
Controller buttons function but no joystick input recognized so character movement cannot take place. This renders the game unplayable.

About 2 hours in and I'm loving this game.  Love these games with the 3rd person view and use of the xbox controller. Sometimes it's nice to be able to kick your feet up in vr and play a "traditional" style game.
Critical error on launch.
Recognises some buttons except for the joystick

Update 9/2021 - I have posted fixes for both the DLL error and entitlement errors in the forum so you can play this again!  (thanks to the guru who put together the fix for the entitlement issue), tested and works (search for Herobound entitlement error in forum)

WE loved this game and found the puzzles and gameplay great.  It has broken recently with the latest Oculus update, but I found a fix for it by using an older plugin.  See the forums and search for Herobound spirit champion fix for full details.
Game was great, but after 3 starts game resetting my pc all the time after loading. I deleted game and installed again. Not work  ;(
I can't get enough of the adventure game style.  Please keep making more!!!

I got this game when it was being given away for free and all I can say is, WOW. Def. worth the 9.99 normal asking price. This is the kind of game I LOVE in VR. Similar to Luckys Tale and Chronos. Not as polished but a ton of fun!
very good game
This is basically a Zelda game. Somehow similar to Ocarina of Time.

review_title: One of the best VR games so far
one_reviews_text: I really enjoyed the game even though it was so basic. Sometimes when I was struggling with a puzzle for a half an hour, it really started feeling like I was hanging out in the room with the main character. Also it's kind of creepy that he starts looking at you while standing time to time :D
What a great game, one of the best! Nice puzzles, nice music (especially that of Air Realm) and nice worlds! Waiting for the sequel!

review_title: Would like more games in this variety
one_reviews_text: Fairly easy puzzle platform game.   Having a lot of fun working my way through the game.
game = gud so downlod now you know
I think the only thing its missing so far is some armor for this little dude. I have been having a ton of fun with it though!

Played this game for about 10 minutes, then the buttons on my controller quit working. Since then, every time I load the game up, the buttons do not work and I cannot get off the selection screen at the beginning. Controller still works fine for other games, but not this one.

review_title: Top game, but not working anymore.
one_reviews_text: I like the game very much, but the game in not longer working with the current Oculus version, so I have to give only one star. I tried to contact the developer, but no response. I wish they would make an update so that it will work again.
I like this game. No AAA graphics at all, but the gameplay is fun. Give it a try, i would even buy this one.
I just played it for 1.5 hours and wondered how quick the time has passed!

Others here have compared this game to Zelda......ummmm no. Graphics are nice, and didn't get too far in the game, as I really couldn't get "into it". Again for some reason It just didn't feel "fun". If I had to try to guess why, was that it somehow had a "cell phone game" type feel. All in all, give it a chance perhaps you might like it. If you like playing games on your cell phone, you might just like it on the Rift. Again, please don't compare this to Zelda.

review_title: For GearVr its nice, but here...
one_reviews_text: Hero is ugly) Graphics from GearVR and a bit boring. Gameplay is OK and some puzzles are interesting.

XBox controller works fine with other games but for some reason the keys aren't even recognized to start the game.  It just sits at "Press Key to Begin," I can't remember if it was A or B but I tried every button several times, removed batteries from controller, repaired, tried touch controllers — nothing worked.
it doesn't work :(

Overall: A great game with fun mechanics and progress. I got the game while it was free, but after having played it I would gladly have paid $10.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gameplay: Right from the get go it was a lot of fun being emerged into the world - VR suites the game very well. You see your character from above and control him while killing creatures with your sword, bow and other items you obtain through out the game. You are able to upgrade your weapon and health and you're even able to buy new abilities which I found very entertaining. It's always nice being able to tell the difference between your upgraded attacks.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The story: For the games purpose it's a well written story. A bit childish maybe, but I felt like it suited the game.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Controls: It was my first time playing a game requiring a gamepad and I was a bit hesitant about it. I quickly came to like the controls though.
(To the developers: There should be a sprint mechanic so you won't have to run at the same pace all the time or roll around.
Another thing I would like to mention about the controls is that the switching of items should not be with the arrow keys. It should be with the LT & RT.)

I got this game before it was free, and I loved it.  The graphics are cute, and the gameplay is very entertaining.  If you're looking to see a retro Zelda-style game given the VR treatment, look no further than this wonderful little package.

I played it on a 2.5x2.5m surface. Standing, kneeling, sitting, looking behind things while I moved the little guy around.
The game is fun, relaxing, looks very good in VR (pixel override to 2), it's not frustrating and a easily approachable game.
It took me 7h to finish and makes me long for MUCH MUCH more! There is not a single thing I didn't like in this game.
More please!

I love this game. If you ever played zelda than you will love it. Very simaliar to the older games, but in vr. I used a xbox controller and it worked perfect. I kept playing this game wondering why it was free. There is so much content. I have 8 hrs so far and im still going. The puzzels are challenging but fun. Better than luckys tale imho.
Game starts mostly as a puzzle solving game and later turns into a mob bashing. Story isn't great, but is a simple fun RPG that lasted me 7-8 hours.
I'm enjoying this more than Chronos. A bit zelda like and really fun, especially good for free :)

The game might not look appealing when you see pics of it, but it's actually pretty fun playing it. This is not an RPG game, it's an adventure game.  The fighting mechanics are pretty good. Some enemies are challenging to defeat, making it fun to play. You acquire a good number of weapons that aid you in puzzle solving and that give you options in deafeating foes and bosses. Dungeons are fun to explore with well designed puzzles that make you use a little bit of your brain power to solve. Music and sound effects are well done.  I actually enjoy listening to the characters talking, they sound fascinating !
Game is pretty fun until you play for hours and run into game killing glitches.

review_title: It does not work without sensors, Again?
one_reviews_text:
Why is the game in the Gear VR works without sensors in the Oculus Rift and requires connection of sensors.
What for? Why this game tracking sensors, you really are morons?
Oculus sucks.
Cant play anymore, buttons on controllers wont work!!!!

Didn't expect much from this but was very surprised with a high quality and entertaining title. Very nicely polished and lots of fun. Seems to be within the focal sweet spot for the rift (diorama level) where things look especially incredible. Definitely one for showing VR to those with a weaker stomach. More pls devs! 

P.S Why the heck is this free?

A less pretty "Chronos" without less RPG and more puzzles. The combat is very minimalistic, but tight. I experienced a crash numerous times going through a particular door, and I've seen others get the same - this game is not without bugs! But you get almost 6 hours of free decent gameplay - give it a shot!
You can't start the game as none of the gamepad keys work.
Plays great!  Roman it needs sensors to see what you are looking at... do you even begin to know how the Rift works?

While this does not have the polish/ depth of a zelda game, if you are looking for an Oculus game to fill the retro Zelda sized hole in your life look no further. Lot of fun and lengthy campaign for VR

review_title: Any Zelda fan will love this!
one_reviews_text: Very fun puzzels, thinkin outside the box is necessary! Also, if you like this, you'll probably like Chronos too.
One of the best games for free. I dont understand the complaints here. These game is for free and a nice Zelda wannabe clone! Play it!
It's a very fun game, but sometimes the controlls don't respond
I was impressed by this free game and had a good time with it.  I haven't beat it yet, but i plan to.  Clearly made to be a Samsung VR title.
A great little RPG platformer.  A lot of elements taken from Zelda.  Simple but fun puzzles and battles.  I liked the subtle nods to Star Trek TNG in the village.
What else do you need to know?
Nice game
Love this game. Haven't played more than a few hours and can't wait to play more. Hope more games that are this charming become available for VR.
I clocked over 6 hours of gameplay. It has a zelda feel to it and it feels worth the price. Many games make me regret the money I spent on it, but this was a fun game.
Like the others have said, it's reminscent of the good ole RPGs - like Zelda. Pretty good gameplay with puzzles.
The game reminded me of a zelda-ish game in vr........oh the posibilities!
Free, big, beautiful, finished. I liked it :)
I would definitly recommend this game to those looking for an RPG!
cannot install

review_title: One of the greatest VR experiences ever.
one_reviews_text: i picked up this game after glimpsing at the arena version for vr. i did not regret it. this game will take you back to the days of good old platforming, with a new and spicy VR twist. in my oppinion, the game was far too short. i STRONGLY encourage the devs to release an expansion, or a second game!
These kinds of action adventure games are my favorite.
Bought it while it was not free and don't regret it. Plays like the old Zelda games.
I would definitly recommend this game to those looking for an RPG!
